fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

While acessing the link available on the email notification about new comments done to a Pull Request, Bitbucket UI doesn't show the comment.
This happens because the comment is only available on the "Outdated Comments" section of the file being inspected.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Ask an user to add a comment to a line of code into one of your repository files 
 # Access the link available on the email notification about this comment

h3. Expected Results

The pop-up with the "Outdated comment" should be loaded showing the content of the comment

h3. Actual Results

The Pull Request page is loaded and the navigation redirect the user to the file with the comment, however, the pop-up where the comment is present isn't loaded.

h3. Workaround

It is possible to,using the link available on the email notification, trigger the pop-up to load by accessing the URL twice.
eg. 

https://bitbucket.org/MYWORKSPACEID/REPOSITORYNAME/pull-requests/66#comment-169954576
fields.summary: The links available on the email notification doesn't properly redirect us to Outdated comments

fields.description:
Hi,

In my organization we have 100+ repository and we create new ones weekly.

All our repositories share the same settings(permission, branch permission, branch model, merge permission, ecc...) and every time we create a new one we have to configure the same settings again and again.

I think would be nice to have a set of default configurations for the repositories in the workspace, or at least the option to copy the settings from an existing repository.
fields.summary: Default repository settings

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Deleting a user on users on plan page intermittently duplicates the global sidebar

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Navigate to the workspace settings
# Then the "Users on plan" section 
# Delete a user using the 'x' icon to the right

h3. Expected Results
* User is deleted

h3. Actual Results
* The global sidebar if duplicated a few times 

h3. Workaround
* Refresh the page and things will go back to normal
fields.summary: Deleting a user on users on plan page can intermittently duplicate the global sidebar

fields.description: Currently, on Bitbucket, whenever the approval gets reset when there are new changes on the PR, the PR will show all code for the code reviewer to review instead of only what was changed after the last approval. This feature request is to add the ability for the PR reviews to only show the code that was changed after the approval was reset for every individual PR reviewer.
fields.summary: As a PR reviewer, have the ability to view the code that has changed only after the previous approval

fields.description: At this moment it is not possible to filter the results on *Users on plan* and *User groups*. To find a specific user, it's necessary to go over all results – page by page – until you can find what you are looking for. It would be good to have the functionality to search for the users.
fields.summary: Add ability to search for users on Users on plan

fields.description:
Currently within Bitbucket cloud, when you add a Pull request comment, they are all grouped on the activity feed into 1 with only showing the latest comment's content. 

Since each comment can potentially create a separate thread this is confusing, since we  group threads and independent comments together into 1 active link from Activity. 

*Recommendation:* 
 * each independent comment should appear separately on the PR Activity
 * Threads should be grouped into 1 and show only the Original comment and then a link to the thread, so that its easy to find
 * stop grouping all independent comments under 1 link since they may not be related to one another
fields.summary: Separate Pull Requests comments on Activity  feed instead of grouping them

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Please note, this request is +*not the s**ame as*+ https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/BCLOUD-17859.

This feature request is for pull request pipelines (that run based on the source branch at the moment), to also run when the destination branch of such PRs gets updated.

A pull request pipeline merges the destination branch into the working branch before it runs. If the merge fails, the pipeline stops.

If there are new commits in the source branch, the pull-request pipeline will get triggered again, doing a new merge in the "Build Setup", and then running the build.
 However, if there are new commits in the destination branch of the same PR, the pipeline won't get triggered.
h3. Suggested Solution

Considering that this pipeline runs on a merge commit, it would be desirable for some users to have the pipeline triggered when the destination branch changes as well. This way, the build will run on the new merge commit before the PR actually gets merged.
fields.summary: Trigger pull request pipelines when the destination branch changes

fields.description:
Currently there is a feature to add default reviewers to a repository.

My requirement is to be able to add a further set of reviewers when a specific folder within the repository is modified.

 

For instance I have configured default reviewer +John+, +Jane+ for the repo "*thecode*"

I would like a rule such that any code change in

*thecode/database* adds +Mary+ also as the default/mandatory reviewer of that PR

*thecode/configurations* adds +Bob+ into the reviewer list of the PR
fields.summary: Allow addition of default reviewer for a particular folder in the repo

fields.description:
Currently, when we browse to a repository page, and click the 'Clone' button in the top-right corner, we get a dialog box with a 'git clone' command that we can copy to the clipboard. This is convenient.

However, if the repository has any submodules, the basic clone command does not initialize them properly. The best way to clone in that case is using the `--recurse-submodules` flag.

When a repository has submodules, Bitbucket should detect this and adjust the clone command accordingly to `git clone --recurse-submodules path`. It's easy to detect if there are submodules because in that case there will be a `.gitmodules` file in the project root.
fields.summary: Detect submodules and adjust clone command

fields.description:
It's very handy that I can filter by branch prefixes `bugfix/`, `hotfix/`, `feature/`, and `release/`. However, for better or worse, I frequently use more and different prefixes than the four recognized by Bitbucket (e.g. `backup/`, `developer-name/`, etc.). It would be great if:
 # Bitbucket could handle (i.e. filter on) *any* prefix, rather than the predefined list of four.
 # There was a toggleable option to nest branches by prefix in the UI, to keep my screen tidy when I have a lot of branches.
fields.summary: Better handling for branch types (prefixes)

fields.description:
Feature request to add "oidc flag" as one of the options that can be configured in the yml global options settings. 

 !image-2021-09-17-20-34-22-224.png|thumbnail! 

Currently it is not supported under "options" 

This would help user's will multiple steps on current pipelines setup to enable oidc without much change to the existing pipeline
fields.summary: oidc flag at global yaml configuration

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

 

Various places in the UI show a count of repos, but some of these counts include the Mercurial (hg) repos that users no longer have access to/BBC no longer supports. We should filter those out from the total count.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Observe a [workspace's repo count|https://bitbucket.org/account/workspaces/] and compare it to the count (manually counted) repos in the [dashboard repos page|https://bitbucket.org/dashboard/repositories].

h3. Expected Results

Repo counts should be same across pages.
h3. Actual Results

Repo count isn't the same.
h3. Workaround

There is no workaround.
fields.summary: Hg (Mercurial repos) are still included in repo count in various places in UI

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Some links to other parts of private repo render with "Restricted link..." text in private repo's PR comments/editor, while other links render fine. In this case, a link to another PR rendered with "Restricted link..." text.

!Screen Shot 2021-09-15 at 11.37.42 AM.png|width=664,height=136!

Calls to {{https://bitbucket.org/gateway/api/object-resolver/resolve/batch}} dictate the rendering behavior it seems.

When link renders correctly (in this case linking to same repo but at root level rather than a specific PR)
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # In a private repo, add a comment to a PR with two links
 ## link to another PR
 ## link to another part of the repo (just the repo's root dir/homepage)
 # notice that the 2nd link renders without the "Restricted link..." text while the first link includes it.

h3. Expected Results

Both links should render without the "Restricted text...".
h3. Actual Results

The [https://bitbucket.org/gateway/api/object-resolver/resolve/batch] response for links that render with the "Restricted link..." text includes the following body:
{code:java}
[{"body":{"meta":{"access":"forbidden","visibility":"restricted","auth":[{"key":"bitbucket","displayName":"Atlassian Links - Bitbucket","url":"https://id.atlassian.com/outboundAuth/start?containerId=291a4822-17aa-4a1b-bb4f-b2c78f37e21c_993208ff-d553-4680-a7eb-22ef643e8920&serviceKey=bitbucket"}],"definitionId":"50e6ca53-ec7d-4c73-a920-d14b585cb972","key":"bitbucket-object-provider","resourceType":"pull","version":"2.0.5"},"data":{"@context":{"@vocab":"https://www.w3.org/ns/activitystreams#"},"@type":"Object","generator":{"@type":"Application","name":"Bitbucket","icon":{"@type":"Image","url":"https://wac-cdn.atlassian.com/assets/img/favicons/bitbucket/favicon-32x32.png"}},"url":"https://bitbucket.org/skhadri-rename-again/test-repo-renamed/pull-requests/8"}},"status":200}]
{code}
The status is 200, but the access is "forbidden". When the link renders fine, the access is "granted"
h3. Workaround

No known workaround. Link still renders but just includes the "Restricted link..." text.
fields.summary: Some links render with "Restricted link..." text in private repo's PR editor/comment

fields.description:
Currently, if there is branch permission set for a branch to "Prevent a merge with unresolved merge checks", then the Pull Request merge will not be allowed if any of the Pull Request builds is failed for the same source branch.

For example: if we open a Pull Request (let's call it Pull Request #1) to merge "branch-1" into "master", it shows Pipelines for all other Pull Requests that also happen to have "branch-1" as the source. If someone else has a Pull Request for merging "branch-1" into "broken-branch", and that Pull Request (let's call it Pull Request #2) has a Pipeline that is failing, Pull Request (#1) will also be blocked because this other one has a problem

This feature enhancement is for Pull request merge checks to check only the current Pull request build status and not others.
fields.summary: Pull Request merge should only check the build status of the current Pull Request

fields.description:
G'day team!

I have had a request from a customer to change the way that notifications are handled in the context of mentions. 
Currently, despite all repository notification settings - unless you are "watching" a pull request, you will not receive a notification if someone mentions you on a pull request by tagging your name. The "watcher" setting at present takes full precedence over any other setting.

The customer believes that mentions are a deliberate way of trying to get someones attention and can easily be missed if they are not a "watcher" on the issue, so should send out a notification regardless of their "watcher" status.

Thank you,

Ben
fields.summary: Mention notification should occur even for non-watchers on pull requests

fields.description:
In the "Merge pull request" dialog box, the "Merge commit" and "Squash" merge strategies show an editable commit message, while the "Fast forward" strategy has a grayed-out "commit message" box that shows nothing at all.

Instead of showing nothing, could the "Fast forward" merge strategy show a preview (non-editable, of course) of the commit messages for the commits that will be merged?

Thanks!
fields.summary: Show preview of commit messages for fast forward merges

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Currently, we have the “Request changes” option on Pull Requests, however, we don't have a "Changes done" option to inform the reviewers that the code has been updated and the user who created the PR is not able to able to revert the "Requested Changes" icon back. 
h3. Suggested Solution

Add a "Changes done" option in the Pull Request to inform the reviewers that the code has been updated or add the possibility to the user who created the PR to revert the "Requested Changes" icon back. 
h3. Workaround

The user can add a comment to inform the code was updated.
fields.summary: Add a "Changes done" button in the Pull Request page

fields.description:
Currently, you can only add file level comments to the files in the main pull request view.

It would be great if this functionality could be added.
fields.summary: Add File level comments to View Entire File modal

fields.description:
Will be a good idea to do something like this

 

```shell

- step:

  <<: *aws-deploy-to-ecr-and-s3
  after-script:
    - aws s3 cp ./build s3://pouch-site-dev --recursive
```

 

Here is a pretty good explanation:

* https://objectpartners.com/2021/05/18/bitbucket-parameterized-pipelines/
fields.summary: Parametrize builds

fields.description:
When creating a pull request, it can be helpful for the author to add their own annotations and comments through the code to explain context.

However each of these results in an email to all reviewers increasing spam.

It would be useful if there was a way when creating the PR, for the author to be able to add the annotations as well as the regular PR description in all one shot (or perhaps progressively) without the email spam.
fields.summary: PR to allow author to annotate code without it spamming all reviewers

fields.description:
Currently, if the branch permission setting "_Check the last commit for at least N successful build and no failed builds_" is enabled/ticked, it will only check the last commit build status.

*Enhancement request:*
 It would be useful for customers if we can ignore validating if the commit has the *[skip ci]* commit message and proceed to the next commit.
 Or we can also add it as a setting in branch permission with something like: "Ignore [skip ci]
 builds"
fields.summary: Branch permission ignore commit with [skip ci]

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Currently, the timeout for aws-ecs-deploy pipe is hardcoded to 10 minutes. 

h3. Suggested Solution

Make the timeout configurable.
fields.summary: Add the option to configure the wait timeout for aws-ecs-deploy pipe

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Creating a branch name using the ui with "=" symbols is stripped out on the UI. If proceed with creating the branch the branch is created without "=" in the name.
 !Screenshot 2021-09-13 at 12.37.28 PM-1.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Got to repositories branch
# Create branch
# Add the following name "foo=bar/test"

h3. Expected Results
The branch is created with foo=bar/test

h3. Actual Results
The branch is created with foobar/test

h3. Workaround
Workaround is to create the branch locally and push it over to remote.
fields.summary: Creating a branch name using the ui with "=" symbols is stripped out on the UI

fields.description:
I'm using Jenkins with bitbucket-branch-source-plugin, and it seems that Bitbucket cloud is hiding users emails which causing the environment variable *CHANGE_AUTHOR_EMAIL* to be *null*

please add the ability not to hide users emails in your api so we will be able to use the environment variable *CHANGE_AUTHOR_EMAIL*

 

more here:

[https://github.com/jenkinsci/bitbucket-branch-source-plugin/issues/482]

[https://github.com/jenkinsci/bitbucket-branch-source-plugin/blob/e508712bdb9f2f54cd2106048fafe6ddf1ab7a18/src/main/java/com/cloudbees/jenkins/plugins/bitbucket/client/pullrequest/BitbucketPullRequestValue.java#L88-L91]
fields.summary: unhide users emails

fields.description:
Currently the code is hardcoded to only tag latest if we're on branch `master`

 

We have moved away from this naming convention however in our pipe repos we have to keep `master` if we don't want to add any additional logic to have our docker image tagged latest.

 

here's the current code used - https://bitbucket.org/atlassian/bitbucket-pipe-release/src/master/pipe/pipe.py
{code:java}
if branch == 'master':            
   return ['latest', version]
{code}
fields.summary: bitbucket-pipe-release to push latest tag on configurable branch name

fields.description:
With the current Repositories API, we don't have the ability to determine which repositories has "Require Issue Key" feature enabled. 

You can get it from Repository Settings > Links. 

However, when there is a large number of repositories, it's a tedious task to go through each one. 

The suggestion is to include this data into an API which can be ran against the repositories.
fields.summary: API to lookup repositories with "Require Issue Key" Enabled / Disabled

fields.description:
{panel:title=(i) Implementation of New Features Policy| borderStyle=| borderColor=| titleBGColor=#e0efff| bgColor=}
At the moment, we can't set an ETA for this feature to be released, since there's a number of factors that determine how our product team prioritizes new features. Consider adding yourself as a watcher to be kept informed as to the state of this feature request moving forward. With that way, if our development team updates the ticket, you'll be notified via email.
You can learn more by reading [Implementation of New Features Policy|https://confluence.atlassian.com/support/implementation-of-new-features-policy-201294576.html].
{panel}

h3. Problem Definition

The *react to comments* feature needs to be implemented in BBC as well.
https://confluence.atlassian.com/bitbucketserver/commenting-on-a-pull-request-1027119882.html

h3. Suggested Solution

Provide the ability to react with emoji:

 !image2020-10-22_9-40-32.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround

None. Consider adding yourself as a watcher to be kept informed as to the state of this feature request moving forward. With that way, if our development team updates the ticket, you'll be notified via email.
fields.summary: Emoji reaction to comments

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

If you have the branch permission setting "_Allow automatic merge when builds pass_" enabled and try to merge a pull request (by closing the source branch), the source branch is not being deleted.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Use an existing or new repository with Pipelines enabled
 # Add a *sleep* command for the YAML file with the *default* trigger to make sure the build will take some time to succeed later
 ** E.g.
{code:java}
pipelines:
  default: 
    - step: 
        script:
          - echo "test"
          - sleep 2m
{code}

 # Create or use an existing pull request
 # Add/edit branch permission for the destination branch with the "_Allow automatic merge when builds pass_" setting enabled under *Merge conditions*
 # Edit the pull request and make sure the "*Delete branch*" is ticked
 # Push a commit to the source branch
 # While the Pipelines build is *In progress*, merge the pull request
 # Lastly, go to the repository branch page

h3. Expected Results

The source branch of the PR will be deleted
h3. Actual Results

The source branch of the PR is not being deleted
h3. Workaround

Manually deleting the branch
fields.summary: Merging a PR using `Allow automatic merge when builds pass` in branch permission setting does not close source branch

fields.description:
We would like to be able to, as Pull Request creators, add ourselves as a reviewer to the Pull Request.

This is necessary for us to be able to use functionalities like branch permissions and restrictions properly.

(i) We can take the commit author in the equation and if it doesn't match the Pull Request creator allow the second to be added as a reviewer.
fields.summary: Allow the Pull Request creator to be added as reviewer

fields.description:
Suggestion:
* Add an ability to create/destroy runners based on the need.
* Ability to control the number of runners required at any given time. 
* Add auto-scaling logic to control runners.
fields.summary: Auto scaling in Pipeline runners
It is not possible to revert Pull Requests merged with fast-forward strategy

fields.description:
I've raised 2 tickets but no one is responding.
Can you help me?

CA-1498692
CA-1495950
fields.summary: Need help!

fields.description:
Description:

1. Recently one of the app passwords got leaked to public domain, and the credential was used to clone few of our repos (Bitbucket cloud).  We would like to stop this from happening again, I would like to know if there's a way we can restrict cloning/accessing repos from a certain IP range.

2. I would like to get notified if any repository is made public on our Bitbucket cloud account.

Please suggest a way to implement these?
fields.summary: hardening bitbucket access

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Whenever the owner of the personal Workspace views access under the User directory, it shows the following error message:
 !Screenshot 2021-09-08 at 12.18.22 PM.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Navigate to personal Workspace settings
# Under User directory, click your own username *View access*
# It should return an error message as the screenshot above

h3. Expected Results
The UI should show the user access to the repositories since it's a personal Workspace, so any repositories created will directly assign admin access to the user.

h3. Actual Results
The UI failed to show the user access list

h3. Workaround
There is currently no workaround available, we will update this once we found any.
fields.summary: View access on user directory for personal Workspace doesn't show any list

fields.description:
I would like to suggest the addition of a notification with transfer link to the receiving account dashboard.

A notification is already available for the account transferring the repository however reliance on email to notify the new account of the transfer is unreliable and causes days of delays.

BitBucket home already displays recent repositories, which would be the perfect place to add a notification when a repository transfer request exists. The workspace repository list would also be an excellent place to display a repository incoming transfer request.

If this was in place, it would have recently saved a week of struggle with emails and retrying the transfers.
fields.summary: Repository Transfer Notification in dashboard of receiving workspace

fields.description:
Currently, the .gitattributes parameter merge=union does not affect the PR diffs.
This feature request is to change this behavior so that this attribute is used within the PR diff on Bitbucket.
fields.summary: Fix regression to reflect diff options if .gitattributes is set to merge=union
Activity API endpoint is not automatically retrieving the inline field information

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Inviting the owner of a personal workspace to one of the workspace's repos gives an error.

The owner of a personal workspace gains automatically access to any workspace repositories, so an invitation is not needed in this case.
However, this access is not displayed in workspace's Settings, please see [BCLOUD-21334|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/BCLOUD-21334].

If the owner thinks they don't have access and they try to add their user to a repo, they get an error.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a new Bitbucket Cloud account
 # Create a new repository that is owned by the personal workspace created automatically for this Bitbucket Cloud account
 # Go to this repository's *Settings* > *User and group access*
 # Select *Add members*
 # Type the email of the Bitbucket Cloud account that is owner of the workspace, select any type of access, and then *Confirm*

h3. Expected Results

A message that says this user already has access to this repository.

h3. Actual Results

An error is shown, with the message 

Issue adding new user
The following user could not be added by email: "<email>". Try again.
 !Screenshot 2021-09-06 at 16.10.30.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround

 Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Adding a personal workspace's owner to a repo shows an error

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Personal workspaces don't show access for the owner of the workspace:

 # Create a new Bitbucket Cloud account
 # Create a new repository owned by the workspace created automatically for this Bitbucket Cloud account
 # Go to this workspace's *Settings* > *Users on plan* > select *View access* for the user that owns this workspace, and the following message is displayed:  !Screenshot 2021-09-06 at 16.04.20.png|thumbnail! 
# Additionally go to this workspace's *Settings* > *User directory* > select *View access* for the user that owns this workspace, and the following message is displayed:  !Screenshot 2021-09-06 at 16.05.29.png|thumbnail! 

Even though the user automatically gets access to this workspace's repos, the pages above do not show the user's access.

This can create confusion for users, consider the following scenario:
 
Someone may try to clone/push to a repo of their workspace and face an error for a reason unrelated with access rights. 
The error message may include the line "Please make sure you have the correct access rights".
Then the user checks the pages mentioned above, sees the empty dialogs when trying to View access for their user, and they think that their user doesn't have access to the repo. 

h3. Suggested Solution

Show owner's access in the following pages for personal workspaces:

workspace's *Settings* > *Users on plan* > select *View access* for the user that owns this workspace 
workspace's *Settings* > *User directory* > select *View access* for the user that owns this workspace
fields.summary: Show owner access for personal workspaces

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Currently, workspace's user groups are not showing all email addresses where it used to show all.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Change a user's email address's visibility to "Only you and admins" from Atlassian account's settings - [https://id.atlassian.com/manage-profile/profile-and-visibility]
 # Go to a workspace's user group where the user is added

h3. Expected Results

The email address of the user will be visible
h3. Actual Results

The email address of the user is not visible in the user group
h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Not all email address are showing on workspace's user groups

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Jira Projects are not linked under "JIRA Issues" after using the issue key in any commit message or PR

h3. Steps to Reproduce
* Create a new test repository
* Commit a file adding "Issue Key" via smart commit
* Navigate to "Jira Issues" and you should be able to see Jira projects automatically linked with all the issues listed
* Now try to "unlink" the project from "Manage linked Jira projects"
* Re-integrate JIRA from workspace settings now follow step 2
* You will not be able to see "JIRA projects/issues" under "JIRA ISSUES" unless you link manually

h3. Expected Results
Issues should be linked automatically 

h3. Actual Results
Issues are not linked 

h3. Workaround
Link the issues manually:
* Navigate to "Manage linked Jira projects"
* Select the Jira project that has to be linked
fields.summary: Jira projects are not automatically linked with Bitbucket "JIRA ISSUES"

fields.description:
h3. Summary
The user wishes to host the runner on an arm64 machine

h3. Suggestions
Support arm64 host machine

h3. Workaround
Install runner on Linux_amd64 machine and use QEMU emulator to run docker image on arm64
fields.summary: Support arm64 runner host

fields.description:
Microsoft has integrated support for github in VS2022.
They have made it possible to use bitbucket, but extra steps are needed.

You should create a youtube video to make these steps simple and obvious.
You should also contact Microsoft, so that Bitbucket is also integrated into VS2022.
fields.summary: Create youtube video for Visual Studio 2022 Preview to access bitbucket

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

At the moment, the Repositories : Read permissions for OAuth gives Read access to both commits of a repository as well as its source code.

Add-ons developed for Bitbucket Cloud may only need commits information to work. However, when installed on a certain workspace, they also gain read access to repos' source code as well. This may not be desirable by end-users who want to use a certain Bitbucket add-on, but without granting source code access to the add-on when it is not needed.
h3. Suggested Solution

Provide more granular OAuth permissions for 'Repositories', e.g. separate permissions for commits, source, etc.
 This way, developers of add-ons can restrict the add-on permissions e.g. to commits only, providing better security.
fields.summary: More granular scopes for OAuth Repository permissions

fields.description:
Currently, the .gitattributes parameter merge=union does not affect the PR diffs.
This feature request is to change this behavior so that this attribute is used within the PR diff on Bitbucket.
fields.summary: Reflect diff options if .gitattributes is set to merge=union

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Source branch is not deleted during automatic merge of a pull request with all the build checks passed
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a new branch and make some change
 # Make a PR from the newly created branch to the master. enable "source branch deletion".
 # Click on the merge button as soon as you create the PR, notice the information in the PR merge you get
 # You will observe that Pull request gets merged as soon as the build on the PR become successful

h3. Expected Results

After the pull request is merged, the source branch should get deleted.
h3. Actual Results

The source branch shown in the list of Active Branches.

h3. Workaround

Manually merge PR so that source branch gets deleted. In case of automatic merge, user need to delete the source branch manually.
fields.summary: Source branch is not deleted during automatic merge of a pull request with build checks passed

fields.description:
App developers have requested the ability to get a complete commits’ hashes list when a user or {{git gc}} removes them from a repository on Cloud.

For further context, see the follow developer community topic:
[https://community.developer.atlassian.com/t/ability-to-receive-a-complete-list-of-removed-commits-via-webhook/50316]
fields.summary: Provide a mechanism to retrieve commits which have been pruned

fields.description:
Hello, 

Would it be possible to have a REST API to create a Task in a pull request, either providing pull request or comment ID

Please let me know your opinion.

Regards,

JLuis
fields.summary: REST API to create a task in pull request

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

We are noticing an intermittent error "the app Bitbucket prlinks failed to load" when we click on "go to pull requests" in commit page.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Go to a commit page
 # Click on "go to pull requests" 

h3. Expected Results

It should load "Reviewed in these pull requests" window

!Screenshot 2021-09-02 at 10.35.37 PM.png|width=573,height=208!

 
h3. Actual Results

It will keep loading and will time out with error "the app Bitbucket prlinks failed to load"

  !Screenshot 2021-09-02 at 10.34.19 PM.png|width=564,height=154!
h3. Workaround

After it times out, when we refresh the page, it loads "Reviewed in these pull requests" window without any error.
fields.summary: We notice an intermittent error "the app Bitbucket prlinks failed to load" when we click on "go to pull requests" in commit page.

fields.description:
Hi,

 

I would like to create a webhook and have it fire on commits on a specific branch only, but I don't see how I can select the branch when creating webhook.
fields.summary: webhook on specific branch

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When changing a workspace avatar, it generates a *HTTP 400 error*. 
This issue is reproducible only in workspace avatar on *Firefox browser*. Tested on Firefox 91.0.2 (64-bit)
Works well on Google Chrome

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Open your Firefox browser
# Navigate to your Workspace Settings
# Click "Change avatar" on the right hand side of the page
# Upload a JPEG or PNG Image


h3. Expected Results
Image gets uploaded to workspace as avatar successfully

h3. Actual Results

* Bitbucket responds that image is uploaded
* However image is not uploaded
* Open browser console and you'll see this error message : 
** {code}
Only image/{png,jpeg,gif} content-types are allowed.
{code}

h3. Workaround
* Workaround is to use Google Chrome browser to upload the workspace avatar.
fields.summary: Changing Avatar image on workspace shows HTTP 400 Error

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Code formatting is not working in PR comments (python or java).
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 * Go to PR review screen
 * Create a comment
 * Add a code block to comment
 * Set the language to Python
 * Click save

h3. Expected Results
 * code block uses syntax highlighting

 * If you click to edit comment, Python is still selected in the language dropdown

!IMG-2747.jpg|width=489,height=117!
h3. Actual Results
 * Code block flickers with correct syntax highlighting and then returns to default code styling

 * If you click to edit comment, Python is not selected (no language is set)

  !Screenshot 2021-09-01 at 12.08.53 PM.png!
h3. Workaround
 * The developers can still view non-formatted code in the comments.
fields.summary: Code block language selection does not persist after saving comment

fields.description:
I think a feature where the author of a PR could pin or somehow highlight “where to start” with a review would be useful. Something like “here’s the core of the change, look at this first and the rest will make sense”.

Or even a way to categorize changes so that they appear separate in bitbucket. For example:
 * core changes
 * secondary changes caused by the core changes
 * “boy-scout rule” or “refactoring” changes
fields.summary: Provide authors with a way to streamline or structure a PR in order to help reviewers

fields.description: h3. Issue Summary In markdown, relative links like [regulatory compliance](../../admin/compliance/) get turned into regulatory compliance, where the trailing "/" is dropped. BBC urls like /admin/compliance/ only work with the trailing forward slash while others like /admin/access work with/without it. This inconsistency means some relative links get rendered that 404 on access. h3. Steps to Reproduce Create link in markdown like [regulatory compliance](../../admin/compliance/) to point to your repo's compliance admin page. This is just one page as an example that requires the trailing "/". h3. Expected Results Rendered link works as expected (whether with "/" or not the user shouldn't be bothered). h3. Actual Results Notice the hyperlink generated when the Markdown is rendered won't include the trailing "/" which is needed for that specific page (while not for some others). Clicking on the link takes you to a 404 page. h3. Workaround Workaround would be to use absolute URLs where the forward slash isn't removed upon render.
fields.summary: Relative links in Markdown don't include trailing "/" which breaks links on some Bitbucket pages that require it

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

If you create a branch permission by "type" for a branch (lets say master), and restrict "write access" to NO for all users, when you navigate to the Pipelines page and try to set up a sample pipeline, the "commit file" option is blue.  BUT clicking on this would not result in anything. Console logs will show a sentry ID indicating branch permission error. 

 !image-2021-08-31-20-34-02-190.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 * Create a new Repo
 * Branch Permission -> By Type -> master -> " NO write access and merge via PR access on Master branch"
* Go to pipelines page -> Select Starter Pipeline. 
* At the yml configuration page "Commit File" is blue. 
* Click on the same -> NO result 
* Open console -> You will see a sentry ID generated while clicking on commit file which points to "Branch Permission Error". 

h3. Expected Results

When Branch Permission is created "by name", then the system blocks you from commiting a file. 
 !image-2021-08-31-20-37-54-813.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Actual Results
When Branch Permission is created "by type", UI makes it look like you can commit the file (but you can't)
 !image-2021-08-31-20-38-29-682.png|thumbnail! 


h3. Workaround

* Create Branch Permission "by name".
fields.summary: Creating Branch Permission by "Type" for a branch causes a UI error in Sample Pipeline run

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

After deleting a comment with a "Task" using the UI, Bitbucket doesn't update the right navigation bar removing the task from it.

It is necessary to manually reload the page in order to have it displaying the correct information.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Creeate a Pull Request
# Add a comment to the Pull Request
# Add a Task to the comment
# Delete the comment

h3. Expected Results

Task and comment get removed from the right navigation bar

h3. Actual Results

The comment is removed from the right navigation bar but the task is not until the page is completely reloaded

h3. Workaround

Reload the page and/or clear cached information forces the UI to refresh the right navigation bar, removing the task of the deleted comment from it.
fields.summary: After deleting a comment with a "Task", Bitbucket UI doesn't remove it from the page unless you reload it

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Currently, we only has Open, Merged and Declined in the PR dashboard to filter the PR. It'd be great to have more filter status of the PR such as waiting for review, waiting for changes/updated and need another review. 

h3. Suggestion
Add more PR filter options and status for PR to ease up reviewer, this way the reviewer doesn't have to go to each PR to get an update
fields.summary: Add more PR status in PR dashboard tab to filter PR

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Currently, in the Bitbucket UI whenever a user is moving their repositories project in bulk to another project, the button show as adding repositories instead of moving. Logically the user is moving repositories to another project and not adding repositories.

h3. Suggestion
Change the wording on the add repositories button to move repositories
fields.summary: Moving repositories to a new project button wording should be changed to Move instead of adding

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

If a repository file contains non-ASCII characters in its name, or if it exists in a directory with non-ASCII characters, its history is not visible in the *Source* page of a repo.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a repository in Bitbucket Cloud and clone it
 # In the clone of this repo, either create a file with non-ASCII characters in its name, e.g. τεστ.txt, or create a directory with non-ASCII characters and then a file with ASCII characters, e.g. τεστ/myFile.txt
 # Add and commit the changes
 # Make some changes in the file of step 2, add and commit them
 # Push these two commits in the Bitbucket repo
 # Open the repository in Bitbucket website and go to its *Source* page
 # Select the file you created in step 2 to view its source code
 # While viewing the file, try both of the folloiwng actions:
 (a) Right above the content of the file, there is a dropdown with the text *Source*. Select that, and switch to *History*
 (b) Right above the content of the file, there is a dropdown showing the last commit that changed this file. Select this.

h3. Expected Results

*(a)* Selecting *History* should show a list of commits that changed this file:

!Screenshot 2021-08-30 at 13.26.04.png|width=761,height=133!

*(b)* Selecting the last commit that changes this file should also show the commit history, like below:

!Screenshot 2021-08-30 at 13.24.32.png|width=192,height=139!
h3. Actual Results

*(a)* Selecting *History* shows the error
{quote}No commits available
 Having trouble showing file history
 Normally, you'd see this file's commit history, but something didn't go right.
{quote}
!Screenshot 2021-08-30 at 13.30.32.png|width=643,height=203!

*(b)* Selecting the dropdown that shows the last commit that changed this file, doesn't show any previous commits that changed this file:

!Screenshot 2021-08-30 at 13.30.48.png!
h3. Workaround

*(1)* One option is to rename the directory/file name with the *git mv* command, and use a name with ASCII characters.
 However, doing so will not preserve the history of the file.

*(2)* Another option that will preserve file history is to use *git filter-branch* in order to rename the directory/file name with non-ASCII characters, and use a name with ASCII characters.

+Please note that this will rewrite history in the repo+, so the commit hashes will change.

The following commands can be used for changing the file name and directory name respectively in a clone of the repo, adn then the changes will need to be force pushed to Bitbucket:
{quote}git filter-branch --tree-filter '
 if [ -f "<old name>" ]; then
 mv "<old name>" "<new name>"
 fi' --force HEAD
{quote}
{quote}git filter-branch --tree-filter '
 if [ -d <old name> ]; then
 mv "<old name>" "<new name>"
 fi' --force HEAD
{quote}
fields.summary: Viewing the history of a file that contains non-ASCII characters in its name or path shows an error

fields.description:
A feature where user's can select one or mutiple lines of a diff and enter in-line comments. Similar to how in-line commenting works in confluence. 

 !image-2021-08-27-17-34-06-306.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Ability to select one or multiple lines in Pull Request and put in-line comments

fields.description:
Currently if there are any changes made to the APIs, there is no alerting mechanism to notify Bitbucket API consumers.

It will be of great help if we can add "Subscribe to Updates" in the bitbucket API page, something similar to the status page.

!Screenshot 2021-08-27 at 2.28.22 PM.png|width=785,height=66!
fields.summary: Add "Subscribe to Updates" in the bitbucket API page

fields.description:
[This doc|https://support.atlassian.com/bitbucket-cloud/docs/variables-and-secrets/] lists a variety of default Bitbucket Variables that are available to a custom pipeline.

It would be very useful to offer the name of the pipeline as a variable so that when a script is complete and notification is sent to the notification channel, the name of the pipeline could be included. This would allow me to write more DRY code.

Right now I've written a notification script that does the logic, the JSON message assembly, and the curl to the webhook, but because the pipeline name isn't available as a variable, I have to pass it into the script as an input. And I have to do that for every pipeline that uses this script. It's a surprise to me that something like BITBUCKET_PIPELINE_UUID is available to me, but not BITBUCKET_PIPELINE_NAME.
fields.summary: Expose Custom Pipeline's Name as default Bitbucket Variable

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
As per the title, when inviting a new user to Bitbucket Cloud, the following will show up:
 !Screen Shot 2021-08-26 at 16.48.16.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Invite a new user to an existing Bitbucket group;
 # The following message will show up under the user's name:
 !Screen Shot 2021-08-26 at 16.48.16.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Expected Results
The date of the invite is shown correctly.

h3. Actual Results
"Invalid date" shows up under the user's name, every time a new invite is sent.

h3. Workaround

 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Inviting a new user to a Bitbucket Group shows an "Invalid date" error message under the e-mail of the invited user

fields.description:
Currently Bitbucket pipelines only offers public API endpoints for pipelines: 

[https://developer.atlassian.com/bitbucket/api/2/reference/resource/repositories/%7Bworkspace%7D/%7Brepo_slug%7D/pipelines]

As a customer we would like to request similar public endpoint for the pipelines runners.

With the following requirements:
- manage global workspace/repository runner config, as we as per runner config over-rides
- get status summary for runners - i.e. details of runners that are running, idle, and their last activity timestamp, etc.
- get list of queued steps for all sets of labels
fields.summary: Have public API endpoints for pipelines runners

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Using the VSCode extension to add a comment in a Bitbucket Cloud Pull Request that has a conflict on it causes the comment to be added on the line shown on the diff, but not on the exact line that was added on VCode.

Basically, let's say we have the following file:
{code}
21 testing
22 test
23 t
24 this
25 is 
26 a
27 test
{code}

If there's a conflict on this file, Bitbucket's diff will display it like so:
{code}
21 + <<<<<<< destination:abcdeea41033335f050fe2272287555137a14ec7
22 + =======
23 + testing
24 + >>>>>>> source:123456493d3936ceea99419f29314bb85064dabf
25 test1
26 test
27 t
28 this
29 is 
30 a 
31 test
{code}

On VSCode though, the diff shows on the same line, rather than having separate lines for diff reviews.

This causes a discrepancy where if a comment is added on line 24 in VSCode taken from the example above, it will actually shift to line 31, effectively commenting in the incorrect line

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a PR that has a conflict
 # add a comment to it using the VSCode extension. The commented line on VSCode will be the same, but the commented code will be different due to how diffs are handled in Bitbucket.

h3. Expected Results
The comment should go in the exact code that it's added on in VSCode

h3. Actual Results
The comment is following the code line instead of the actual code where the comment was made. This causes the code line that the comment was added to to be incorrect.

h3. Workaround

Currently, the only workaround is to add comments to PRs directly on Bitbucket instead of through VSCode. There are no known workarounds for adding comments directly via VSCode.
fields.summary: Creating comment from VScode in a Bitbucket PR that has conflicts causes the comment to be added on the incorrect line

fields.description: The Activity filters added in BCLOUD-19748 are good, but I''d really like one that shows me everything others have done on the PR. I know my comments, but I want to see what others are saying and replying.
fields.summary: PR Activity filter for all comments except my own

fields.description: As per the title of this feature request, this is to change the golang example in Bitbucket Pipelines to use gomodules instead so that it better reflects current real-world usage of golang.
fields.summary: Change Golang example to use gomodules

fields.description: This feature request is to add a flag to Bitbucket Pipelines that allows builds to run on Pipelines instead of using the self-hosted runner instance, if the self-hosted instance goes offline.
fields.summary: Flag to run Pipelines Cloud if Runners is offline

fields.description:
Provide the support of AWS managed node groups in Pipeline Runner.

"managed node groups" means that it is a cluster with autoscaling in AWS. Autoscaling requires an automatic runner registration on a node start and we currently don't support it.
fields.summary: Support of AWS EKS managed node groups in Runner

fields.description: Provide support for liquibase or regdate plugins in Bitbucket Pipeline.
fields.summary: Support for support liquibase or regdate plugins in Pipeline
Update the "Get started" new repo page to allow for non-master main branches

fields.description:
We want to disallow merging source branches which have not been rebased onto the target branch. The Pull Request interface already detects this condition and shows a message like:

*32* commits behind "workspace/origin-repo:develop".  Sync now
 
However this condition does not currently prevent use of the "Merge Pull Request" UI.
 
We'd like a merge check option that forbids merging of a pull request to a given target branch unless the source has been "synced" (eg rebased) onto the target branch.
fields.summary: Add a merge check for source branch up-to-date

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently, it's not possible to download all the branches on a repository using the Download section, you need to download one by one. 


h3. Suggested Solution
Add the option to download all branches of a repository at once.
fields.summary: Add the option to download all the branches at once

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Cannot load "pipelines settings" page on a newly created repo
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a new repository without including ".gitignore" or a "README" file
 # Go to repository settings
 # Navigate to "pipeline settings" page to enable pipelines

h3. Expected Results

The page should load normally
h3. Actual Results

Page never loads

The below exception is thrown in the console:
{noformat}
Console error:
{code}
deprecate.js:8 DEPRECATED API - AP.require() has been deprecated since ACJS 5.0 and will be removed in a future release. No alternative will be provided.
{code}
{noformat}
h3. Workaround

As an alternative, enable Pipelines under your *Pipelines* tab by setting a Pipelines YAML file - [https://bitbucket.org/cwdevelopers/leighdaniellaw.cwdevelop.com/addon/pipelines/home#!/getting-started]
 * Click *Select* (On top of Starter pipeline) card
fields.summary: Cannot load "pipelines settings" page on a newly created repo

fields.description:
the online search for terms in repository looks only on master branch

is a big limit because normally code changes are in lower branches

we should have a new modifier i.e. branch: (like repo: and ext:) to specify the branch target of the search
fields.summary: capability to search online in a specific branch

fields.description: Pull request intermitently shows incorrect files in the diff, but branch view shows the right diff.
fields.summary: Intermittently Incorrect files in PR diff in the UI

fields.description:
strong textcurrently, the "Admin Page" extension point only has:
 * org.bitbucket.account.admin
 * org.bitbucket.repository.admin

Being able to add new pages at the project level would be useful for setting project-level defaults
fields.summary: app extension point for project-admin sidebar items
Ability to return 2fa information on the API

fields.description:
Currently there is an existing feature which allows the users to disable the console messages at a user level. 
This setting can be found in Bitbucket Settings -> Account Settings -> Enable console messages.


Suggestion:
* To  include a feature to disable console message at a repository level.
fields.summary: Ability to disable console messages while pushing to Bitbucket at a repository level

fields.description:
If we self-approve a PR it just doesn’t count towards merge checks, though the author of the PR is part of the default reviewers.

Also this behaviour needs to be documented in https://support.atlassian.com/bitbucket-cloud/docs/suggest-or-require-checks-before-a-merge/

 

!Screenshot 2021-08-17 at 5.05.15 PM.png|width=937,height=130!
fields.summary: Add PR self-approval count towards merge checks

fields.description:
Jira and Bitbucket integrate via the [DVCS configuration|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver/integrating-with-development-tools-using-dvcs-1047552689.html] within both tools. In Jira, you can remove old/stale integrations that are no longer desired but this is not possible within Bitbucket itself. Leading to lengthy Bitbucket configs and excessive options for selecting Jira instances for normal users.

Please provide a method to remove these integrations as needed rather than only disconnecting, leaving the instance in your config.
fields.summary: Remove Jira old/stale Jira Integrations
Improve Bitbucket Pipelines Validator to detect Configuration errors

fields.description:
Currently, we only have the [skip ci]/[ci skip] feature for a [commit level|https://support.atlassian.com/bitbucket-cloud/docs/bitbucket-pipelines-faqs/] that Pipelines validates.

*Feature request:*
Some customers prefers to have a push-level [skip ci]/[ci skip] instead of commit level one.
fields.summary: Pipelines Push level skip ci

fields.description:
*Summary:* 
With the new UI update, we do not have an option to select all the repositories at once while adding a new group to existing repositories under a workspace. Instead, we have an option to choose or select multiple repositories one by one manually which is time-consuming.

I would be great to have an "ALL" option to select all the repositories at once.
fields.summary: Provide an option "ALL repositories" while adding a new group to workspace repositories

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Sometimes, when a build exceeds the max-time limit set within the bitubucket-pipelines.yml file, the build will not update the duration of each individual command during the build, and the total build time will differ from the sum of times of each command within the build execution.
This is intermittent.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Have a build include the max-time flag;
 # Run this build. Intermittently, when max-time is exceeded, the sum of all commands' time will not match the total build time.

h3. Expected Results
Each command's time sum will match the total build time

h3. Actual Results
Intermittently, when max-time is exceeded, the sum of all commands' time will not match the total build time.

h3. Workaround

 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Elapsed time within build is different from total build time

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary Currently Bitbucket repository Webhooks doesn't handle redirect requests. Eg: we have two services to handle webhook requests, w1 and w2. we configure w1 as Bitbucket webhook, if we setup w1 to redirect requests to w2 and if we send http 301 status from w1 to Bitbucket cloud, Bitbucket cloud in-return doesn't send the request to w2.  h3. Steps to Reproduce # Create two services to handle webhook requests, w1 and w2. we configure w1 as Bitbucket webhook # We setup w1 to redirect requests to w2. when Bitbucket make request to w1, we send http 301 as response status code to Bitbucket cloud. bitbucket webhook not redirect requests to a new endpoint w2 when it receives a 301 status code. h3.   h3. Expected Results bitbucket webhook should redirect requests to a new endpoint w2 when it receives a 301 status code. h3. Actual Results The below is the webhook error: {noformat} 301MovedPermanently

301MovedPermanently

{noformat} h3. Workaround The redirection should be currently handled at primary webhook service receiver.
fields.summary: Support URL redirects for Bitbucket repository Webhooks

fields.description: It would be very interesting if it were somehow possible to see which pull requests are conflicting directly in the dashboard/overview. Today, to find out if there is a conflicting pull request, it is necessary to access them one by one.
fields.summary: Show conflicts on dashboard/overview

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Currently, if you import a repository from (AWS Codecommit or Github) to Bitbucket Cloud using the [importing tool|https://bitbucket.org/repo/import?workspace=workspace_id], it does not work.
The page says:
{panel:bgColor=#ffebe6}
(!) Your import has failed. For more information, check the log below. You can also try your import again.
{panel}
However, cloning the (CodeCommit and Github) repository locally works fine

h3. Steps to Reproduce
For AWS CodeCommit repo:
# Create a AWS CodeCommit repository
# Create/use an existing IAM user with HTTPS credential
# Import the repository using Bitbucket Cloud importing tool - https://bitbucket.org/repo/import?workspace=workspace_id
For Github repo:
# Create or use an existing GH repository
# Import the repository using Bitbucket Cloud importing tool - https://bitbucket.org/repo/import?workspace=workspace_id

h3. Expected Results
The repository will be imported into Bitbucket Cloud

h3. Actual Results
Bitbucket Cloud importing tool is not importing the repository

h3. Workaround
Create a new repository in Bitbucket Cloud and push the 3rd party repository there.
{code:java}
git clone --mirror <3rd-party-repo>
cd <3rd-party-repo>.git
git remote add bitbucket <new-bitbucket-git-url>
git push bitbucket --all
git push bitbucket --tags
{code}

*Edited*: August 20, 2021
fields.summary: Importing a repository from a 3rd party source does not work

fields.description: I'd love an option where a reviewer can view a PR one commit at a time, and has next/previous buttons to navigate through all the commits in a PR.
fields.summary: Ability to view PR commit-by-commit
Code blocks on Pull Requests' comments are not accounting for slanted quotes

fields.description: Our repository has a bunch of old commits by users which used their Windows login name, rather than their email address.  These users have since left the company.  I'd like to use aliases to map these commits to their users' disabled accounts (so their profile picture can be used as a visual indicator), but it looks like that isn't currently supported.
fields.summary: Ability to add aliases for disabled users

fields.description: With the new UI for workspace settings, the hyperlinks have been removed from the groups name, so now it is not possible to click on a group and be redirected to that group's management page. I would be great if the hyperlinks got added again.
fields.summary: Bring back hyperlinks to groups from the Repository's Users and group tab

fields.description:
Our repo owners would like to ensure that active branches are deleted as soon as their pull requests are merged. At this time, the user creating the pull request can check the Delete on Merge box, but there's no way to guarantee that it's done.

It would be extremely helpful to have the ability for a repo admin to be able to set this at the repo level, rather than relying on users to do it on each pull request.
fields.summary: Provide ability to set default value for Delete on Merge at repo level

fields.description:
Currently, the behavior of the "Check the last commit for at least
X successful builds and no failed builds" branch permission is to only allow merges of a PR if a certain number of builds has passed, and if there are no failed builds on that commit.

That said, if a build is in *an in-progress* state, and if another build that fulfills the requirements of the branch permission completes before it, the PR will be mergeable, even if the in-progress build might end up failing. 
This might be undesirable since build times are quite variable, and the in-progress build might have critical tests that might break something.

The workaround for this is to set a higher number of builds on the branch permission, though this is not desirable, since you would have to edit multiple branch permissions every time you add a new build or test to a branch.

The requirement of this feature request is to add branch permission to only allow merges if all builds are successful, and do not allow in-progress builds to be merged.
fields.summary: Don't allow in-progress builds to be merged

fields.description: When using the left-rail search feature in Bitbucket, results should show project matches and the search algorithm should consider the Project's Name and Description fields within the search.
fields.summary: Search feature should search Project Name and Project Description fields

fields.description:
*Summary: *
Show the deployment status of last deployment of a repository under the project.   

*Suggestion:*
Currently we can see the build status of each a repository under a specific project but in order to see the latest deployment status, we would need to navigate into each repository. 

Goto Projects --> Repositories --> Shows the list of repositories with Repository name, size, Last updated, builds. Deployment status is currently not shown here.
fields.summary: Show deployment status of each repository at the project level

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Images cannot be added to the default pull request setting 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Navigate to the repository setting
# Navigate to the 'Default discription' under the Pull request section
# Click on the image icon to add an image
# Nothing happens

h3. Expected Results
* Window should appear allowing user to select an image

h3. Actual Results
* Noothing happens 

h3. Workaround
* Add the image when creating a new pull request
fields.summary: Add image icon on default pull request description setting is not working

fields.description: Similar to the insights offered in Jira deployments window. Produce reports on average build time, number of failed builds, number of builds per day etc to allow us to track important build metrics and identify issues.
fields.summary: Insights

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When there's an existing pull request (created from a forked repo) and someone pushed a combined commit (rebased) using squash in the forked repo, the file comments in the PR get outdated automatically.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Fork an existing repo
 # Create a new branch from the forked repo
 # Clone locally and update some changes into 1-2 files of the forked repo
 # Create a new PR from the forked repo to the main repo master branch
 # Add some file line comments into those 1-2 files
 # Add some file changes locally and commit it
 # This time, do squash the latest commit to the previous commit (Run *git rebase -i HEAD~2*, then change the second commit from "pick" to "squash")
 # Once done, do a force push (*git push -f*)
 # Refresh the existing PR and notice that all comments are outdated

h3. Expected Results
 * The PR comments will not be marked as outdated comments

h3. Actual Results
 * The PR comments were marked as outdated comments after pushing to the forked repo

h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Pushing a rebased commit in a forked repo marks PR file comments as outdated

fields.description:
When user selects to log out from their Bitbucket Cloud account, they are only presented with options: 
1. Log out

2. Log in to another account 

But there is no option to go back to the existing session. 

Suggestion: Please add a "Go Back" button. Its not clear that in order to stay logged in you should click the browser back button.
fields.summary: Please Add "Back " button to the Logout screen
